page.title: 15VERGES & VERGE CUTTING
page.content: In spring many species can be seen growing on the verges including primroses,celandines and cuckoo flower In winter there are many places where the sweet smelling Winter Heliotrope can be found. In May the lanes are lined with Cow Parsely followed by Hogweed and other umbels in July. Fleabane is pelentiful in Aug. and Sept. The verges are machine cut about twice a year leaving an unsightly mess which is left to rot. In 1985, the Council cut the verge just as the clover, buttercups and moon daisies were coming out. Verges should only be cut when the flowers have had a chance to seed. Some verges must be kept cut for safety where growth would obsure motorists view. Our lanes are a delight in Spring but do need to be tidied up later in the year - as in the days of the roadman.
